qa.question: What do you mainly use your phone for?
qa.answer: Calling customers and relatives, WhatsApp for sending photos of stitched clothes, YouTube bhajans.

qa.question: Do you share your phone with others?
qa.answer: Yes, my daughter and husband also use my phone.

qa.question: What are your favorite apps?
qa.answer: WhatsApp and YouTube.

qa.question: Do you read permissions?
qa.answer: No, I just press Allow or OK.

qa.question: How do you decide if an app is safe?
qa.answer: If my daughter or nephew says it is okay, I use it.

qa.question: Have you deleted content?
qa.answer: Yes, I deleted some customer photos.

qa.question: What do you do before repair?
qa.answer: I don’t know how to delete anything, so I just give the phone.

qa.question: Have you asked for help?
qa.answer: Yes, I ask my daughter or neighbor’s boy.

qa.question: Who do you trust most?
qa.answer: I trust talking in person.

qa.question: Do you use code words?
qa.answer: Yes, sometimes nicknames with my sister.

qa.question: Have you helped someone install an app?
qa.answer: No, I ask for help myself.

qa.question: Do you know how to stop permissions?
qa.answer: No, I didn’t know apps can use those things.

qa.question: What do you do with warnings?
qa.answer: I get scared and ask my daughter.

qa.question: What do you think happens when you give access?
qa.answer: I think maybe they only use it to work properly.

qa.question: Have you hesitated to repair?
qa.answer: Yes, but I had no choice.

qa.question: Has a repair person opened your gallery?
qa.answer: Yes, once the repair guy opened my photo gallery.

qa.question: Do you use a password?
qa.answer: No, because my husband and daughter also use the phone.

qa.question: Do you think local apps are safer?
qa.answer: I don’t know.

qa.question: Who do you turn to?
qa.answer: My daughter or nephew.

qa.question: Do people influence your safety thinking?
qa.answer: Yes, my daughter told me not to open strange messages.

scenarios.Broken Phone: I give it to the shop and hope they don’t look inside.
scenarios.Sharing with Family: If I get a message when my daughter is using the phone, she reads it out.
scenarios.New App Requesting Permissions: I don’t install apps. My daughter decides.
scenarios.Helping Elderly Relative: I’m not good with apps myself.
scenarios.Using Someone Else’s Phone: If I see something private, I ignore it.
scenarios.Giving Away Phone: I will ask someone to delete everything.
scenarios.Cloud Backup Surprise: I don’t know what cloud is.
scenarios.Free Public WiFi: I don’t use WiFi in cafes.
scenarios.Friend Needs Help: If a close friend needs money, I give in person.
